> > That's a completely separate debat=
e and in my experience, closed source
> > software is usually much better a=
t publishing and maintaining API's than
> > open-source (Microsoft being a =
pretty good example), but let's save this
> for
> > another day.
>
> On thi=
s, I guess our experiences really do differ. I work hardly at all
> with Mi=
crosoft APIs, but in the Java world, the open source stuff tends
> to be as=
 well or better documented than the proprietary stuff.


Interestingly, I c=
an't say that I work with a lot of closed-source Java
API's, so I can't com=
ment on that either. However, I can say that I have
seen open-source Java A=
PI's that are excellent and just about as many that
are horrendous, hence m=
y disputing your argument that "open source API's are
usually better than c=
losed source ones". I'm not saying one is better than
the other, just that =
the quality of API's seems to have nothing to do with
whether these API's a=
re open or closed source.

As for Microsoft, I was simply pointing out that=
 they are excellent at
maintaining backward compatibility for API's. You ca=
n literally run in 2005
programs that were written in 1995.


Sure there's =
a lot of poorly documented, poorly written open source
> software,
> but th=
is tends to sink to the bottom and fall out of use pretty quickly.
> The li=
braries people actually use are much better documented than their
> proprie=
tary equivalents. (Probably effect rather than cause, but either
> way...) =
I suspect it also matters that one of the easiest ways for
> someone to con=
tribute to a project is to start writing some
> documentation patches. This=
 means open source documentation tends to
> improve with time. Proprietary =
documentation rarely does.


That I disagree with.

Popularity is what brin=
gs quality in documentation, and it works for closed
and open source alike.=
 If a closed source software becomes popular and
generates a big community,=
 the documentation will follow. It's no different
than the open source worl=
d.

But we should probably stop this discussion since it's clearly off-topi=
c for
this list.
